channel.title: Wow... need a miracle please!
channel.description:
Okay, I have a Blank 317 source and client because I want to learn how to Host/Code.
When I go into the source folder or client folder and click compile, it says this:
[code]Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. You have sucsessfully compiled[/code]
Then when I click on Run to turn on the server, it says this:
[code]Your server is now up..... Error occurred during initialization of VM Could not reserve enough space for object heap Could not create the Java Virtual Machine.[/code]
Plus, IDK if I portforwarded right, may you please look at this photo and tell me?
[IMG]http://i26.tinypic.com/e5lny8.png[/img]

item.title: Wow... need a miracle please!
item.dc:creator: @twin_kings twin kings
item.description:
@twin_kings wrote:

I have the same problem i was trying to make a webclient and i fuck up my client and my source is not working anymore
if anybody have a solution let me know send me a message. Thank you.

Read full topic

item.title: Wow... need a miracle please!
item.dc:creator: @Its_Me_Y Its Me Y
item.description:
@Its_Me_Y wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Make sure there’s no other methods for the IP string.

Try looking in the client’s client class for “setserver”
or “43594”[/quote]

Okay, I went there and found out the IP was set to 0.0.0.0 I changed it and still doesn’t work.

How do I check if there is IP string?

this is how it looks like:
Under setserver (“127.0.0.1”, “43594”);
method2(503, false, 765)

item.title: Wow... need a miracle please!
item.dc:creator: @Vince2 Vince,
item.description:
@Vince2 wrote:

[quote=“Its Me Y, post:50, topic:351759”][quote author=Vince, link=topic=448112.msg3288794#msg3288794 date=1280384880]
Go back to your server files, and open server.java or server.ini, and check the port, and he said he couldn’t find it, with the extensions, .java and .ini are known extensions, so they’re hidden, as to .ivaniisn’tascoolasme, would show.
[/quote]

public static int serverlistener Port = 43594; //43594=default[/quote]

Well, if everything’s running, then I’m not sure… Can’t be of much more help. Maybe Vain will know what to do.

Read full topic

item.title: Wow... need a miracle please!
item.dc:creator: @Vince2 Vince,
item.description:
@Vince2 wrote:

[quote=“Its Me Y, post:43, topic:351759”][quote author=Vince, link=topic=448112.msg3288767#msg3288767 date=1280384071]

I had to change the IP back to mine, had it 127.0.0.1 before
they are set to mine but error connecting again

Keep the IP as localhost / 127.0.0.1, make sure you’re changing the IP in Gui.java, and make sure your server’s running on port 43594 (server.ini / server.java), and try, if nothing… I don’t know.
[/quote]

I cant find Server.Ini or .Java[/quote]

Control Panel > Folder Options > View > Show extensions of known files, check it.

Read full topic
